abstract: <jats:p>The investigation of 331 specimens of the acalypterate dipteran family Lonchaeidae within the GBOL-project resulted in a list of 29 species from which one is new to science, <jats:italic>Priscoearomyia bausenbergensis</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>, and four species represent new records for Germany. For all voucher specimens detailed metadata are provided including validated DNA barcodes. These barcodes build a sound reference basis for future molecular identification of lonchaeid flies and will also allow the inclusion of female specimens in biodiversity studies, when morphological characters for separating these females are not available.</jats:p>
title: The Lonchaeidae (Diptera) of the GBOL project, with the description of a new Priscoearomyia species
